Description page If you want to describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both. Basic page Set these properties to configure the Real-timeOptimizedFlow node. Monitoring page Add, edit, or delete a node's monitoring events. Enable or disable monitoring events by selecting or clearing the check box. Basic Set the basic properties of a monitoring event. Correlation Set the correlation properties of a monitoring event. Every monitoring event must contain at least one correlation attribute, and can contain up to three. Transaction You decide whether events participate in transactions when you configure a monitoring event source. Monitoring page A summary of the monitoring events of the nodes in the flow. Enable or disable individual monitoring events by selecting or clearing the check box. You can click Enable All or Disable All as appropriate. SCARequest node A broker uses this node to send synchronous requests to a service component on WebSphere Process Server, using either SOAP over HTTP or HTTPS, or WebSphere MQ. Description page If you want to describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both. Properties navigator This displays the node properties. Configure the node by selecting the properties and setting their values. Mandatory properties are marked with an asterisk. Basic page Set the SCA definition so that the node properties can be configured for invoking a service on WebSphere Process Server. Binding page Set the binding specific properties on this tab. Only properties pertaining to the binding in the SCA definition (i.e. either MQ or Web-services) are listed on this tab. Response Message Parsing page Set values for the properties that describe the message domain, message set, message type, and message format that the node uses to determine how to parse the response message. Parser Options page Edit the timing properties on this page to control when and how messages are parsed and validated. Set values for the properties that determine how the response parameters are constructed. Transactionality page Specify whether updates are performed in a single transaction as a coordinated message flow or independently. Validation page Set the values to determine whether validation of the output message takes place, and what actions are taken if the message fails. SCAInput node This node is used by a service component in WebSphere Process Server to invoke a service provided by IBM Integration Bus using either SOAP over HTTP or HTTPS, or WebSphere MQ. Description page If you want to describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both. Basic page Set the SCA definition so that the node properties can be configured to allow a service to be invoked by WebSphere Process Server. The message routing property determines whether a common terminal is used, or whether each operation is to be routed to its own terminal. Properties navigator This displays the node properties. Configure the node by selecting the properties and setting their values. Mandatory properties are marked with an asterisk. Binding page Set the binding specific properties on this tab. Only properties pertaining to the binding in the SCA definition (i.e. either MQ or Web-services) are listed on this tab. Input Message Parsing page Set values for the properties that describe the message domain, message set, message type, and message format that the node uses to determine how to parse the incoming message. Parser Options page Edit the timing properties on this page to control when and how messages are parsed and validated. Set values for the properties that determine how the request parameters are constructed. Validation page Set the values to determine whether validation of the output message takes place, and what actions are taken if the message fails. Security page Set values for these properties if you want to configure a security token for use in message flow security. Instances page Select the pool from which additional instances are obtained. Choose either the pool associated with the message flow or the pool associated with the node itself. In the latter case, set the number of additional instances to be given. Retry page Choose how to reprocess a message when a failure gets rolled back to the input node. Transactionality page Specify whether updates are performed in a single transaction as a coordinated message flow or independently. SCAAsyncRequest node The broker uses this node to send asynchronous requests to a service component on WebSphere Process Server using either a Web Service or WebSphere MQ binding. Description page If you want to describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both. Basic page Set the SCA definition so that the node properties can be configured for invoking a service asynchronously on WebSphere Process Server. The SCAAsyncRequest and SCAAsyncResponse nodes must use the same SCA definition value and must have a matching unique identifier. Properties navigator This displays the node properties. Configure the node by selecting the properties and setting their values. Mandatory properties are marked with an asterisk. Binding page Set the binding-specific properties on this tab. Only properties relevant to the binding in the SCA definition (either MQ or Web services) are listed on this tab. Transactionality page Specify whether updates are performed in a single transaction as a coordinated message flow, or independently. SCAAsyncResponse node The broker uses this node to process responses for a previous asynchronous request that was sent to a WebSphere Process Server service using either a Web Service or WebSphere MQ binding. Description page If you want to describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both. Basic page Set the SCA definition so that the node properties can be configured for receiving responses from WebSphere Process Server for a previous asynchronous request. The SCAAsyncRequest and SCAAsyncResponse nodes must use the same SCA definition value and must have a matching unique identifier. Properties navigator This displays the node properties. Configure the node by selecting the properties and setting their values. Mandatory properties are marked with an asterisk. Binding page Set the binding specific properties on this tab. Only properties relevant to the binding in the SCA definition (MQ or Web services) are listed on this tab. Response Message Parsing page Set values for the properties that describe the message domain, message set, message type, and message format that the node uses to determine how to parse the response message. Parser Options page Edit the timing properties on this page to control when and how messages are parsed and validated. Set values for the properties that determine how the response parameters are constructed. Validation page Set the values to determine whether validation of the output message takes place, and what actions are taken if the message fails. Security page Set values for these properties if you want to configure a security token for use in message flow security. Instances page Select the pool from which additional instances are obtained. Choose either the pool associated with the message flow or the pool associated with the node itself. In the latter case, set the number of additional instances to be given. SCAReply node This node allows response messages to be sent back to the WebSphere Process Server for a message that was previously received by a SCAInput Node. Description page If you want to describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both. Validation page Set the values to determine whether validation of the output message takes place, and what actions are taken if the message fails. Properties navigator This displays the node properties. Configure the node by selecting the properties and setting their values. Mandatory properties are marked with an asterisk. SecurityPEP node This node allows the message flow security manager to be invoked at any point in the message flow. Basic page Set values for these properties if you want to configure a security token for use in message flow security. Advanced page Set values for these properties if you want to override the default settings for a WS-Trust v1.3 STS. DatabaseInput node This node responds to database changes and reads the new data from database. Properties navigator This displays the node properties. Configure the node by selecting the properties and setting their values. Mandatory properties are marked with an asterisk. Description page If you want to describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both. Basic page Set the database that this node will respond on its changes. Polling page Enter the polling interval of the node to determine how frequently the node checks for new events of database changes. Retry page Choose how retry processing is to be performed when a flow fails. Transactions page Instances page Select the pool from which additional instances are obtained; choose either the pool associated with the message flow or the pool associated with the node itself. In the latter case, set the number of additional instances to be given. The CICSRequest node calls CICS by using the TCP/IP-based IP Intercommunications (IPIC) protocol, which can be encrypted with SSL. Set the configuration properties for connecting to CICS. The CICS server setting determines whether the node uses a configurable service or not. All nodes using the same configurable service share a connection to CICS and are visible as a single IPCONN resource in CICS. When specifying a commarea length, the length must be the larger of the outbound request data, and the inbound response data. Enter the location for data retrieval. The program name override location allows the CICS program name to be overridden from a field located anywhere within the message tree. Result page Enter the location to which the node sends output and choose whether to copy to the local environment. Response Message Parsing page Set values for the properties that describe the message domain, message set, message type, and message format that the node uses to determine how to parse the incoming message. Monitoring page Add, edit, or delete the monitoring events for a node. Enable or disable monitoring events by selecting or clearing the check box. Edit the timing properties on this page to control when and how messages are parsed and validated. Set values for the properties that determine how the request parameters are constructed. Set the values to determine whether validation of the output message takes place, and what actions are taken if the message fails. Description tab To describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both. Basic tab Enter the name of the adapter component that contains configuration properties for the adapter, or click Browse and select from a list of available files. Specify whether the node can call methods that are defined in secondary adapters, and specify the default method binding to use. Response message parsing tab Set values for the properties that describe the message domain, message set, message type, and message format that the node uses to determine how to parse the incoming message. Transactionality tab Specify whether updates are performed in a single transaction, as a coordinated message flow, or independently. Request tab Enter locations for the business method to be used to perform external actions, and for data retrieval. Result tab Enter the location to which the node sends output and choose whether to copy to local environment. Monitoring tab Add, edit, or delete monitoring events for a node. Enable or disable monitoring events by selecting or clearing the check box. Description tab To describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both. Basic tab Enter the name of the adapter component that contains configuration properties for the adapter, or click Browse and select from a list of available files. Specify whether the node can handle methods that are defined in secondary adapters. Routing tab Choose whether to add the method binding name to the route to label destination list. Input message parsing tab Set values for the properties that describe the message domain, message set, message type, and message format that the node uses to determine how to parse the incoming message. Transactionality tab Specify whether updates are performed in a single transaction, as a coordinated message flow, or independently. Instances tab Select the pool from which additional instances are obtained. Choose either the pool associated with the message flow or the pool associated with the node itself. In the latter case, set the number of additional instances to be given. Retry tab Specify how retry processing is handled when a failure is rolled back to the node. If you select Failure, the other properties cannot be set. Monitoring tab Add, edit, or delete monitoring events for a node. Enable or disable monitoring events by selecting or clearing the check box. Description tab To describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both. Basic tab Enter the location of the email server by specifying a URL or by using a configurable service. A URL must be in the format protocol://hostname:port The protocol can be pop3 or imap. Polling tab Enter the polling interval to determine how frequently the node scans the monitored email server for new emails. Security tab Specify the name of the security identity object that contains the user ID and password to authenticate with the email server. The user ID and password are set by using the mqsisetdbparms command. Retry tab Choose how retry processing is to be handled when a flow fails. Transactions tab Set the transaction mode to indicate whether the message is to be received under sync point. Instances tab Select the pool from which additional instances are obtained; choose either the pool that is associated with the message flow, or the pool that is associated with the node itself. If you specify the pool that is associated with the node, set the number of additional instances. Monitoring tab Add, edit, or delete a node's monitoring events. Enable or disable monitoring events by selecting or clearing the check box. Basic page Specify a decision service by dragging and dropping a decision service (.rules) file on the node, clicking the browse button and selecting a decision service file, typing the decision service name, or double-clicking on the node to bring up the 'New Decision Service' wizard with a default decision service name and pressing Finish. A decision service file contains one or more rulesets. If the decision service is authored in the IBM Integration toolkit, it will have only one ruleset. If the decision service was created by importing an IBM Operational Decision Manager (ODM) Rule Application archive, it can have more than one ruleset. Each ruleset contains a unique set of parameters and a unique set of rules. Only the list of parameters is shown on the Basic tab. All the parameter fields are read-only except the Data location field. An XPath expression is required for each parameter. The 'Use DecisionServiceRepository' configurable service checkbox can only be set for a decision service file created by importing an IBM Operational Decision Manager (ODM) Rule Application archive. Select a WSDL file Select a WSDL file Select an IDL file Select an IDL file Select a WSDL file Select a WSDL file with database binding.
